p.s: The article Hope of escape lost in translation written by Zia Haider Rahman and published on the 17th December 2016 is about how immigrants are treated in Great Britain and which problems they have with the integration.
This text is addressed at all the readers of the Sunday Times.
Since the text is an article of a newspaper it is well structured.
It has four sections and each of them is about an other subtopic of the main topic.
The article is written in a formal language style and has mostly short sentences (cf. ll. 5-8, 1-4).

The author uses different stylistic devices to make his arguments and examples more clear and expressive, for example metaphors (cf. l. 7, ll. 18-19), convincing figures (cf. l. 1) or repetitions like East End (cf. ll. 5, 8, 12).
You also come across a few alliterations while reading like East End (cf. ll. 5, 8, 12), represented a recreation (cf. l. 12) and gained in getting (cf. l. 23).
The arguments of the author are authentic, because he is an immigrant himself and experienced many of these things he mentions.
His own experiences are making the text more real and brings the topic close to the reader.
All in all the article is convincing and shows very good the problems of immigrants in Great Britain.
